text: hi guys today's recipe is a delicious
gingerbread cookie that is perfect for
the holidays start off you'll need two
cups of all-purpose flour and then the
spices that make it so delicious
two teaspoons of ground ginger so
fragrant the smell in here is like the
holidays a teaspoon of cinnamon 1/2 a
teaspoon of nutmeg quarter teaspoon of
ground clove a quarter teaspoon of
baking soda and a quarter teaspoon of
salt I'm using coarse salt so I'm gonna
use 1/2 a teaspoon because it's about
half as salty as regular table salt so
give it a good whisk make sure that
everything is fully combined I have a
tendency to under whisk I think so I'm
trying to make a practice of whisking
just a little bit more so things are
fully combined if you don't whisk
properly or sift properly and your
baking soda or baking powder is not
fully combined into your cake it can
cause air holes in your cake which are
unsightly I mean they don't really
change the flavor but you want a really
nice even crumb okay over here I have
one stick of butter and 1/3 of a cup of
dark brown sugar and to that I'm adding
1/3 of a cup of molasses molasses is
classic and look it's gonna barely come
out unless this is your classic
flavoring for Gingerbread in addition to
